result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A. Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter from DE to Br. 2
Motion hearing on September 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2

Defendant Kyle A. Hendricks in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Defendant Kyle A. Hendricks in custody.  Michael X Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states appearances and recommendations.  Atty Woodard is in agreement and will waive prelim in 14CF29.  Court grants amendment in 14CF29 to Misd. Theft.  Atty Woodard enters NC pleas to Ct 1 in each case.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Woodard makes statement.  Court sentences.  DE advised of felony firearms warnings and voting rights.

13CF267
Ct 1:  NC
6 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 5/9/2014 at 6:30 pm
$268.00 costs to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample and $250.00 DNA surcharge
Ct 2:  Dismissed

14CF29
Ct 1:  Amended to Misd. Theft 943.20(1)(a) - NC
90 days jail w/huber consecutive to 13CF267 and any other sentence
$253.00 costs to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
21 days sentence credit
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Kyle A. Hendricks in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Kyle A. Hendricks in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Time limits continued waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Return date on March 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle A. Hendricks appeared by video means with Attorney Pedersen. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State request $500.00 cash bond.  Attorney Pedersen request lower cash bond or a signature bond.  Attorney Pedersen gives explanation for non appearances.  Courts sets $250.00 CASH bond.  (each file)  Return date scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Stanley V. Woodard in court.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard requests any warrant be stayed so he can get DE to appear.  State requests warrant and objects to stay.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
No contact w/CC; Not leave State of WI; Booking on 3/12/14 @ 1

Return date on March 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle A. Hendricks in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived. State requests $1000.00 Cash and conditions and history of non appearance.  Atty. Woodard makes bail argument.
